byline.contributor: John Mura reported from Morehead, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Sheryl Gay Stolberg contributed reporting from Washington, and Richard Fausset from Morehead.
byline.original: By JOHN MURA and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Gay and lesbian couples arrive at Rowan County, Ky, courthouse to receive marriage licenses--first to be issued after jailing of country clerk Kim Davis; both supporters and protesters gather outside to witness event; controversy still surrounds legality of licenses.
lead_paragraph: As the couples began receiving marriage licenses in Rowan County, Ky., Kim Davis, the clerk who refuses to issue them, was prepared to remain in jail.

headline.main: Marriage Licenses Issued in Kentucky County, but Debates Continue
headline.print_headline: Marriage Licenses Are Issued, but the Debates Continue

snippet: As the couples began receiving marriage licenses in Rowan County, Ky., Kim Davis, the clerk who refuses to issue them, was prepared to remain in jail.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
